name: Updater
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater
description: Yielded to a block to accumulate changes for a patch request.

methods.name: updates
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#updates
methods.description: A list of attributes that were updated.

methods.name: schema
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#schema
methods.description: Returns the table’s schema. This method can also be used to set, replace, or add to the schema by passing a block. See Schema for available methods.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |j|
  j.schema do |s|
    s.string "first_name", mode: :required
    s.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |r|
      r.string "place", mode: :required
      r.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
    end
  end
end

params.name: replace
params.description: Whether to replace the existing schema with the new schema. If true, the fields will replace the existing schema. If false, the fields will be added to the existing schema. When a table already contains data, schema changes must be additive. Thus, the default value is false.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting the schema

params.name: yield.schema
params.description: the object accepting the schema

methods.name: schema=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#schema=
methods.description: Sets the schema of the destination table.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
schema = bigquery.schema do |s|
  s.string "first_name", mode: :required
  s.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |nested_schema|
    nested_schema.string "place", mode: :required
    nested_schema.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
  end
end
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |j|
  j.schema = schema
end

params.name: new_schema
params.description:
The schema for
the destination table. Optional. The schema can be omitted if the
destination table already exists, or if you’re loading data from a
source that includes a schema, such as Avro or a Google Cloud
Datastore backup.

methods.name: string
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#string
methods.description:
Adds a string field to the schema.

See Schema#string.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |schema|
  schema.string "first_name", mode: :required
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

params.name: description
params.description: A description of the field.

params.name: mode
params.description: The field’s mode. The possible values are :nullable, :required, and :repeated. The default value is :nullable.

methods.name: record
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#record
methods.description:
Adds a record field to the schema. A block must be passed describing the nested fields of the record. For more information about nested and repeated records, see Preparing Data for BigQuery .

See Schema#record.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |schema|
  schema.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |cities_lived|
    cities_lived.string "place", mode: :required
    cities_lived.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The field name. The name must contain only
letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_), and must
start with a letter or underscore. The maximum length is 128
characters.

params.name: description
params.description: A description of the field.

params.name: mode
params.description: The field’s mode. The possible values are :nullable, :required, and :repeated. The default value is :nullable.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting the nested schema

params.name: yield.nested_schema
params.description:
the object accepting the
nested schema

methods.name: check_for_mutated_schema!
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#check_for_mutated_schema!
methods.description: Make sure any access changes are saved

methods.name: location=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#location=
methods.description: Sets the geographic location where the job should run. Required except for US and EU.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |j|
  j.schema do |s|
    s.string "first_name", mode: :required
    s.record "cities_lived", mode: :repeated do |r|
      r.string "place", mode: :required
      r.integer "number_of_years", mode: :required
    end
  end
  j.location = "EU"
end

params.name: value
params.description:
A geographic location, such as “US”, “EU” or
“asia-northeast1”. Required except for US and EU.

methods.name: format=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#format=
methods.description:
Sets the source file format. The default value is csv.

The following values are supported:

  • csv - CSV
  • json - Newline-delimited JSON
  • avro - Avro
  • datastore_backup - Cloud Datastore backup

params.name: new_format
params.description: The new source format.

methods.name: create=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#create=
methods.description:
Sets the create disposition.

This specifies whether the job is allowed to create new tables. The default value is needed.

The following values are supported:

  • needed - Create the table if it does not exist.
  • never - The table must already exist. A ‘notFound’ error is raised if the table does not exist.

params.name: new_create
params.description: The new create disposition.

methods.name: write=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#write=
methods.description:
Sets the write disposition.

This specifies how to handle data already present in the table. The default value is append.

The following values are supported:

  • truncate - BigQuery overwrites the table data.
  • append - BigQuery appends the data to the table.
  • empty - An error will be returned if the table already contains data.

params.name: new_write
params.description: The new write disposition.

methods.name: projection_fields=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#projection_fields=
methods.description:
Sets the projection fields.

If the format option is set to datastore_backup, indicates which entity properties to load from a Cloud Datastore backup. Property names are case sensitive and must be top-level properties. If not set, BigQuery loads all properties. If any named property isn’t found in the Cloud Datastore backup, an invalid error is returned.

params.name: new_fields
params.description: The new projection fields.

methods.name: source_uris=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#source_uris=
methods.description:
Sets the source URIs to load.

The fully-qualified URIs that point to your data in Google Cloud.

  • For Google Cloud Storage URIs: Each URI can contain one ‘*’ wildcard character and it must come after the ‘bucket’ name. Size limits related to load jobs apply to external data sources. For
  • Google Cloud Bigtable URIs: Exactly one URI can be specified and it has be a fully specified and valid HTTPS URL for a Google Cloud Bigtable table.
  • For Google Cloud Datastore backups: Exactly one URI can be specified. Also, the ‘*’ wildcard character is not allowed.

params.name: new_uris
params.description: The new source URIs to load.

methods.name: jagged_rows=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#jagged_rows=
methods.description:
Sets flag for allowing jagged rows.

Accept rows that are missing trailing optional columns. The missing values are treated as nulls. If false, records with missing trailing columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. The default value is false. Only applicable to CSV, ignored for other formats.

params.name: val
params.description:
Accept rows that are missing trailing optional
columns.

methods.name: quoted_newlines=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#quoted_newlines=
methods.description: Allows quoted data sections to contain newline characters in CSV.

params.name: val
params.description: Indicates if BigQuery should allow quoted data sections that contain newline characters in a CSV file. The default value is false.

methods.name: autodetect=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#autodetect=
methods.description: Allows BigQuery to autodetect the schema.

params.name: val
params.description: Indicates if BigQuery should automatically infer the options and schema for CSV and JSON sources. The default value is false.

methods.name: encoding=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#encoding=
methods.description: Sets the character encoding of the data.

params.name: val
params.description: The character encoding of the data. The supported values are UTF-8 or ISO-8859-1. The default value is UTF-8.

methods.name: delimiter=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#delimiter=
methods.description: Sets the separator for fields in a CSV file.

params.name: val
params.description: Specifices the separator for fields in a CSV file. BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. Default is ,.

methods.name: ignore_unknown=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#ignore_unknown=
methods.description: Allows unknown columns to be ignored.

params.name: val
params.description:
Indicates if BigQuery should allow extra values that are not represented in the table schema. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. The default value is false.

The format property determines what BigQuery treats as an extra value:

  • CSV: Trailing columns
  • JSON: Named values that don’t match any column names

methods.name: max_bad_records=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#max_bad_records=
methods.description: Sets the maximum number of bad records that can be ignored.

params.name: val
params.description: The maximum number of bad records that BigQuery can ignore when running the job. If the number of bad records exceeds this value, an invalid error is returned in the job result. The default value is 0, which requires that all records are valid.

methods.name: null_marker=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#null_marker=
methods.description: Sets the string that represents a null value in a CSV file.

params.name: val
params.description: Specifies a string that represents a null value in a CSV file. For example, if you specify \N, BigQuery interprets \N as a null value when loading a CSV file. The default value is the empty string. If you set this property to a custom value, BigQuery throws an error if an empty string is present for all data types except for STRING and BYTE. For STRING and BYTE columns, BigQuery interprets the empty string as an empty value.

methods.name: quote=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#quote=
methods.description: Sets the character to use to quote string values in CSVs.

params.name: val
params.description: The value that is used to quote data sections in a CSV file. BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. The default value is a double-quote ". If your data does not contain quoted sections, set the property value to an empty string. If your data contains quoted newline characters, you must also set the allowQuotedNewlines property to true.

methods.name: skip_leading=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#skip_leading=
methods.description: Sets the number of leading rows to skip in the file.

params.name: val
params.description: The number of rows at the top of a CSV file that BigQuery will skip when loading the data. The default value is 0. This property is useful if you have header rows in the file that should be skipped.

methods.name: encryption=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#encryption=
methods.description: Sets the encryption configuration of the destination table.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"

key_name = "projects/a/locations/b/keyRings/c/cryptoKeys/d"
encrypt_config = bigquery.encryption kms_key: key_name
job = dataset.load_job "my_table", "gs://abc/file" do |job|
  job.encryption = encrypt_config
end

params.name: val
params.description: Custom encryption configuration (e.g., Cloud KMS keys).

methods.name: labels=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
Updater#labels=
methods.description: Sets the labels to use for the load job.

params.name: val
params.description:
A hash of user-provided labels associated with
the job. You can use these to organize and group your jobs. Label
keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only
contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and
dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are
optional. Label keys must start with a letter and each label in
the list must have a different key.
